Please note: this form requires JavaScri: Please note: this form requires JavaScript to function correctly. If you are unable to activate JavaScript, we also offer a statement template in Word format (28 KB).
You can use this form to create an acces: You can use this form to create an accessibility statement.
The accessibility statement must be easy: The accessibility statement must be easy for the user to find. A link to the statement should be available on every web page, for example in a fixed footer. For mobile applications, the statement must be available on the website of the organisation responsible for the mobile application in question or appear with other information available when the application is downloaded. If the site is available in several languages, it is recommended that the statement be provided in each language of the site.
Fields marked with a <span class=\"symbo: Fields marked with a * are mandatory.
fill in at least one of the following tw: fill in at least one of the following two fields
URLs of sites to be declared: URLs of sites to be declared
URLs of apps to be declared: URLs of apps to be declared
App URLs on the Apple and Google stores: App URLs on the Apple and Google stores
The compliance status is assessed by a c: The compliance status is assessed by a compliance audit.
Select \"Full compliance\" only if the l: Select "Full compliance" only if post-audit compliance is 100%.
Select \"Partial compliance\" if the lev: Select "Partial compliance" if post-audit compliance is between 50% and 100%.
Select \"Non-compliant\" if a compliance: Select "Non-compliant" if a compliance audit has not been performed or if the post-audit compliance is less than 50%.
Examples of accessibility features: enha: Examples of accessibility features: enhanced contrast mode, font size enlargement, simplified language, etc. Describe the accessibility features available. Explain how to use the accessibility features. Describe the components that are not compatible with assistive technologies.
List non-compliance(s) of the website(s): List non-compliance(s) of the website(s)/mobile application(s) and/or describe which section(s)/content(s)/function(s) are not yet compliant. Indicate alternatives if they exist. Describe in non-technical terms, as far as possible, why content is not accessible, specifying the applicable requirement(s) that are not met. Example: "the login form for the document sharing application is not fully keyboard usable (requirement no XXX (if applicable))".
List the non-accessible section(s)/conte: List the non-accessible section(s)/content(s)/function(s) for which the derogation for disproportionate burden, within the meaning of Article 4 of the Digital Accessibility law of 28 May 2019, is claimed. Indicate the alternatives if any.
List the section(s)/content(s)/function(: List the section(s)/content(s)/function(s) that are not accessible and that do not fall within the scope of the applicable legislation. Indicate alternatives if any.
Insert the date on which the accessibili: Insert the date on which the accessibility statement was first drafted, or subsequently updated, following evaluation of the website or mobile application to which it applies. It is recommended that you carry out an evaluation and update the statement after a major revision of the website or mobile application.
Optional. It is recommended that the cla: Optional. It is recommended that the claims made in the accessibility statement are reviewed for accuracy on a regular basis and at least once a year. If this review has taken place without a full evaluation of the website or mobile application, whether or not it has resulted in changes to the accessibility statement, please indicate the date of the last review.
The Renow control procedure was carried: The Renow control procedure was carried out by the CTIE
Optional. Only for sites and apps produc: Optional. Only for sites and apps produced by the CTIE.
Add a title to your statement: Add a title to your statement
Using this option, you can add a title a: Using this option, you can add a title at the beginning of your declaration (e.g. <h1> Accessibility statement</h1>), for example if your CMS (content management system) does not manage this title itself.
The accessibility statement must be acce: The accessibility statement must be accessible. Its heading hierarchy must be consistent with that of your site. Choose a title level from which the declaration's heading hierarchy can start. If you have added a page title using the previous option, the initial heading level will be applied to this title.
The different versions of your statement:
The different versions of your statement were successfully created.
You can change your input using the button below or the "back" button on your browser.
For each version of your statement, you can copy and paste their content into your CMS.
<strong>Please note!</strong> Once your: Please note! Once your statement has been published, you have one month to inform the SIP of this publication. Send us the URL of your statement by e-mail to accessibilite@sip.etat.lu. Thank you!
Assessment carried out by a third-party: Assessment carried out by a third-party

For each criterion in the framework, an: For each criterion in the framework, an assessment methodology is proposed. It should be noted that this methodology has no normative value. It is intended to serve as a reference point for familiarising oneself with the standard, and to illustrate a potential evaluation method. However, it is acknowledged that other evaluation methods may exist. In addition, the content of this methodology and these steps cannot be used as a basis in the event of a dispute. Finally, it is possible that errors will not be detected solely on the basis of this methodology. Only the content of the criterion and the associated tests have normative value.
